result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.

Lamp: XXX

Corp., Japan) that is equipped with both FID and TCD detectors.The carrier gas was high-purity Ar gas.The isotope-labelled experiments were performed using 13 CO 2 and H 2 18 O as the reactants, and the products were analysed using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (QP2010SE, Shimadzu Corp., Japan). Transient photocurrent and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy measurements were performed using a CHI760E electrochemical workstation.A standard threeelectrode configuration was applied, and 0.5 M Na 2

photocurrent response curves of the electrodes coated with pristine NiAl-LDH and different LDHTC composites were recorded by switching the irradiation light on and off for several cycles (I-t curve, Fig. 7d).No current was generated without light irradiation for all samples. When light was turned on, the current increased sharply due to the photoexcitation of NiAl-LDH.LDHTC composites display significantly improved photocurrent compared with bare NiAl-LDH, implying effectively enhanced charge migration and

specific surface areas and pore diameter distributions were measured using nitrogen adsorption-desorption isotherms at 77 K obtained with an automatic surface area analyser (Micromeritics Tristar-3000, USA).Photoluminescence (PL) emission spectra were recorded using a PerkinElmer LS 55 Fluorescence spectrometer at 355 nm.The photoluminescence (PL) decay profiles were obtained using a Horiba Jobin-Yvon Fluorolog-3-21-TCSPC spectrometer. instruments X-Max).Transmission electron microscopy (TEM) images were recorded using an FEI Tecnai F20 microscope at an accelerating voltage of 100 kV.X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) was carried out on a PHI-5000C ESCA system (Perkin-Elmer) with Mg K radiation (h 1253.6eV).The UV-vis diffuse reflectance spectrum (UV-vis-DRS) was measured using a Shimadzu UV-2600 spectrometer and transformed into an absorption spectrum according to the Kubelka-Munk relationship.
